alert.note: Alert for Amherst; Appomattox; Bedford; Campbell; Charlotte; Rockbridge (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued November 19 at 9:43AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... The Virginia Department of Environmental Quality has issued a health alert through today due to smoke from the Matts Creek wildfire in Bedford County. The areas affected are the counties of Bedford, Amherst, Rockbridge, Campbell, Charlotte, Appomattox and the city of Lynchburg whenever smoke is present. Active children and older adults should limit or reschedule strenuous outdoor activities until conditions improve. People unusually sensitive to air pollution, especially those with heart or lung disease (including asthma), should avoid strenuous outdoor activities until conditions improve. Take more breaks, do less intense activities. People with asthma should follow their asthma action plans and keep quick-relief medicine handy. If you can see/smell smoke near the ground, consider Code Orange or worse conditions and take the necessary precautions, especially if you have existing heart or lung ailments including asthma. Air quality in the Big Island area is very unhealthy for everyone. Significantly cut back on physical activities and sensitive groups should avoid all physical activities. For additional information, please visit the Virginia Department of Environmental Quality`s air quality website at: www.deq.virginia.gov/air/monitoring-assessments/air-quality- forecast.
